summary: Arthur G. Vaivada was a CIA agent who requested reassignment from Cuba in June 1958. He is also known as Ross L. Crozier, and documents related to him are associated with Project HUMANOID in Costa Rica. The documents cover a range of topics including agent activities, contract modifications, project authorizations, and personnel matters. His file includes information about his contract extensions, operational clearance requests, promotion considerations, and suitability for contact agent work. There is a historical listing of organizations identified by the Attorney General deemed subversive in his file.
key_connections: Chief of the Western Hemisphere Division (WHD)
significance: The significance of Arthur G. Vaivada in the JFK context is not explicitly stated in the provided documents. However, his involvement in CIA operations, including Project HUMANOID and his presence in Cuba, could be relevant depending on the broader context of the JFK assassination investigations. Further research would be needed to determine any direct connection.
